title: Buffalo National River: NPS Centennial
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     NPS Centennial            NPS Centennial       The National Park Service turns 100 on August 25, 2016. As we lead up to the centennial, we invite you to participate in Find Your Park Experiences to learn, discover, be inspired, or simply have fun in national parks. Find Your Park Experiences offer unique opportunities to explore national parks both in person and online. Check out the experiences in this park or search all experiences to identify an opportunity that matches your interests. You can also share your national park story at FindYourPark.com. A Call to Action remains the foundation for our 2016 centennial preparations. It is the National Park Service's blueprint for the future, outlining the innovative work we want to accomplish. Buffalo National River is a big part of this effort. Take a look at what we're doing and get involved!   Experiences      Become a Charles Young Buffalo Soldiers National Monument Junior Ranger  Participate in the online Charles Young Buffalo Soldiers National Monument Jr. Ranger program and earn your Junior Ranger badge!  Learn about the nation's first African-American superintendent who also became a leading civil-rights advocate.  Discover the meaningful story of the famed regiments nicknamed the Buffalo Soldiers.  It's yours to discover online, at Charles Young Buffalo Soldiers National Monument. Read more   Exploring the Historic Districts at Buffalo National River  Buffalo National River is an outstanding cultural landscape that embraces the overall story of Ozarks settlement and history. Read more      Call to Action Projects    Learn more about the work we're doing to prepare for the future.
